monogr.title: Pharisaisme and Christianity : compared and set forth in a sermon at Pauls Crosse, May 1. 1608. By I.H. Vpon Matth. 5.20
monogr.author: Hall, Joseph

div.head: To the READER.
div.p:
I Desire not to make any Apologie for the edition of this my Sermon: It is motiue enough, that herein I affect a more publike, and more induring good, Spirituall niceness is the next degree to vnfaithfullness: This point cannot be too much vrged, either by the tongue, or presse. Religion and our soules depend vpon it; yet are our thoughts too much beside it. The Church of Rome so fixes her-selfe (in her adoration) vpon the
crosse of Christ, as if shee forgat his glorie: Many of vs so conceiue of 〈◊〉 glorious, that wee neglect the meditation of his Crosse, the way to his glory, and ours. If wee would proceede aright, we must passe frō his Golgotha, to the mount of Oliues, and from thence to heauen; and there seeke and settle our rest. According to my weake abilitie, I haue led this way in my speech; beseeching my Readers to follow mee with their hearts, that wee may ouer-take him which is entred into the true sanctuarie, euen the highest heauens, to appeare now in the sight of God for vs.
